question: What did the peasant boy dream?
answer1: that he would get a princess, from far, far away, and tat she was as white as milk, and as red as blood, and so rich that her riches had no end

question: Why did the peasant sell all he had and go forth to look for the princess?
answer1: She was so beautiful and winning that he could not go on living without her.

question: How did the whole congregation feel about the dead man?
answer1: disgust

question: What did the people do because the man was a great evil-doer?
answer1: split at it

question: How did the youth feel about the people's treatment of the corpse?
answer1: dislike

question: What happened because money would be needed to bury the corpse?
answer1: The corpse could not be properly buried.
answer2: The man could not rest in peace.
answer3: He could not be granted a Christian burial.

question: Why did the pastor agree to bury the corpse?
answer1: The youth returned with two men, and asked him in their presence whether he refused the dead man Christian burial.

question: Why would no one want to pay all that money to bury the corpse, according to the pastor?
answer1: The man was an arrant sinner.
answer2: The man was not a good person.

question: What happened after the youth had paid for the wake?
answer1: He had but a few shillings left in his pocket.

question: What did the man do after he came up behind the youth?
answer1: asked him whether he did not find it tiresome to wander along all alone

question: Why did the youth not find it tiresome to wander alone?
answer1: He always had something to think about.

question: What did the man offer to be because the youth did not want a servant?
answer1: his comrade

question: How will the youth feel about having a comrade?
answer1: happy

question: Why was the youth glad to have the man as a comrade?
answer1: The youth would have company.
answer2: The youth did not have to pay the man.
answer3: The man traveled at his own expense.

question: Who met the youth and his comrade inside the hill?
answer1: a witch

question: What will happen if the youth or comrade sit in the chair?
answer1: They will be tricked.
answer2: They will get stuck on the chair.

question: What happened because the witch sat in the chair?
answer1: She remained seated.

question: What did the comrade want in exchange for releasing the witch from the chair?
answer1: a sword that hung above the door

question: Why did the witch not want to give the Three-Sisters Sword?
answer1: It was rare.

question: What will the comrade do when the witch offered them the chair to sit in?
answer1: tell the witch to sit in the chair
answer2: trick the witch into sitting in the chair

question: What was the comrade searching for in all the closets and drawers?
answer1: a ball of golden twine

question: How did the witch feel when the comrade asked for the Three-Sisters Ball?
answer1: upset

question: Why did the old witch agree to give up the hat?
answer1: She heard that she would have to sit there until the Day of Judgement if she did not give up the hat.

question: How did the comrade and the youth reach the other side of the river?
answer1: used the golden twine to build a bridge
answer2: flung the ball of golden twine with such force that it bounded back several times
answer3: a bridge made from the golden twine

question: What would happen if the youth did not take the golden twine away quickly?
answer1: The three witches wpuld cross and tear them to pieces.

question: How did the witches feel as they rushed up to the river after the youth and the comrade?
answer1: angry

question: Who lives in the castle?
answer1: the princess of whom the youth dreamed

question: How did the king and the princess treat the youth?
answer1: kindly

question: What was the first test given to the youth?
answer1: take the shears and keep them and give them back to the princess to-morrow at noon

question: What did the princess do while she and the youth were laughing and joking?
answer1: secretly robbed him of the shears without his noticing

question: Why did the youth not notice the princess stealing the shears?
answer1: He was not paying attention.
answer2: He was distracted by the laughing and joking.
answer3: He did not think the task was serious.

question: How did the youth feel when he realized he lost the shears?
answer1: unhappy

question: What will the comrade do because the shears had gone missing?
answer1: help the youth get them back

question: What was special about the enormous goat?
answer1: fly through the air more swiftly than he could walk on level ground

question: Why did the princess not see the comrade?
answer1: The comrade put on the Three-Sisters Hat, which made him invisible.

question: Where did the princess tell the goat to take her?
answer1: to her dearest who waits for her in the hill

question: Why did the princess not want to be with the new suitor?
answer1: She was in love with someone else.
answer2: She wanted none but the troll.

question: What will happen because the comrade saw where the troll had placed the shears?
answer1: He will take them back.

question: Why did the princess give the shears to the troll?
answer1: so the suitor would not find them again
answer2: so the suitor wouldn't have them
answer3: so she would not have to marry the youth

question: How did the princess and the troll feel about the plan to hide the shears?
answer1: excited

question: Why was the princess haughty and snappish towards the youth?
answer1: She thought he did not have the shears.
answer2: She thought he failed the test.

question: What did the comrade do after the princess set out for home?
answer1: swung himself up in back again

question: How will the princess feel when the youth shows he has the shears?
answer1: surprised

question: What was the second task given to the youth?
answer1: keep the princess' ball of twine for her and have it back by to-morrow noon

question: When was the princess able to steal the ball of gold twine?
answer1: while they ere in the midst of their merry play

question: Who told the comrade when the princess rode to her dearest?
answer1: the goat

question: What did the youth discover after he thrust his hand into the pocket?
answer1: There was no ball in it.

question: What will the princess give the troll?
answer1: the ball of gold twine

question: Why did the troll think it was impossible for the youth to have the shears?
answer1: He had locked them up in a chest with three locks and thrust the key into his hollow tooth.

question: What happened after the princess threw the ball of gold twine into the flames?
answer1: The comrade leaped forward and caught it, without being seen.

question: What did the comrade do after retrieving the ball of twine and returning home?
answer1: gave the twine back to the youth
answer2: returned the ball of twine to the youth

question: Why did the princess give the youth a difficult test?
answer1: She did not want to marry him.
answer2: She did not want him to pass the test.

question: What did the comrade have the smith do?
answer1: weld an additional twenty-four pounds of iron on his sword

question: What did the princess think was the reason for her thrashing?
answer1: the weather

question: What was the real reason why the princess had been thrashed?
answer1: The comrade kept giving the princess a cuff here, and a cuff there, until she had received a terrible drubbing.

question: How did the princess feel about her thrashing?
answer1: upset

question: Why did the troll and the princess feel the youth would fail?
answer1: It would be hard to bring the head of the troll.
answer2: The youth will not be capable of bringing the head of the troll.

question: What happened because the princess did not want to fly home alone?
answer1: The troll must accompany her.

question: What did the comrade do once the door closed behind the princess?
answer1: hewed off the troll's head and went up with it to the youth's room

question: Why was the princess merry as a lark?
answer1: She thought the youth would fail.
answer2: She did not think the youth would have the head of the troll.

question: What happened because the youth had what the princess was thinking of?
answer1: She had to take the youth as she had promised.

question: What did the comrade tell the youth to do on his wedding-night?
answer1: close his eyes and pretend to sleep

question: What did the princess look like after her troll-skin disappeared?
answer1: She was lovelier than she had ever been before.

question: What happened because the comrade had brought all the valuables the troll had left to the castle?
answer1: The castle court-yard was so full they could scarcely get through.

question: Why could the goats not fly?
answer1: They were loaded so heavily with gold and silver that they had to walk on the ground and were not strong enough to rise into the air.

question: How did the youth feel when the comrade wanted to part?
answer1: reluctant

question: What was promised to the comrade?
answer1: half of all that the youth may gain in the course of the next five years

question: What did the youth and princess do the whole winter?
answer1: went back and forth with the goats and his father's twelve horses, bringing all the gold and silver home

question: Why did the comrade aid the youth?
answer1: The youth had sacrificed all he had in order that he might have peace, and a burial in consecrated ground.

question: How did the comrade feel towards the youth?
answer1: grateful
